column1: 6D9A0947-87E9-4B7D-971E-122180669579#appfire#C53370A7-3F81-4793-BB20-047776EEF470#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-22 15:36:50.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-22 15:36:50.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#7FFD1FFB-0286-4CE1-9C2E-8863389E2FC7#appfire#C53370A7-3F81-4793-BB20-047776EEF470#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-22 15:36:50.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-22 15:36:50.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#C4B714DC-2A36-429B-8EC4-8E973AF478BC#appfire#C53370A7-3F81-4793-BB20-047776EEF470#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-22 15:36:50.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-22 15:36:50.0#appfire#1
